text:
The Surah takes its name from the very first verse Wan shaqq al-Qamar, thereby implying that it is a Surah in which the word al-Qamar has occurred.

Period of Revelation

The incident of the shaqq-al-Qamar (splitting of the moon) that has been mentioned in it, determines its period of revelation precisely. The traditionists and commentators are agreed that this incident took place at Mina in Makkah about five years before the Holy Prophet's hijrah to Madinah.

Theme and Subject Matter

In this Surah the disbelievers of Makkah have been warned for their stubbornness which they had adopted against the invitation of the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The amazing and wonderful phenomenon of the splitting of the Moon was a manifest sign of the truth that the Resurrection, of which the Holy Prophet was giving them the news, could take place and that it had approached near at hand. The great sphere of the Moon had split into two distinct parts in front of their very eyes. The two parts had separated and receded so much apart from each other that to the on-lookers one part had appeared on one side of the mountain and the other on the other side of it. Then, in an instant the two had rejoined. This was a manifest proof of the truth that the system of the Universe was neither eternal nor immortal, it could be disrupted. Huge stars and Planets could split asunder, disintegrate, collide with each other, and everything that had been depicted in
the Quran In connection with the description of the details of Resurrection, could happen. Not only this : it was also a portent that the disintegration of the system of the Universe had begun and the time was near when Resurrection would take place. The Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) invited the people's attention to this event only with this object in view and asked them to mark it and be a witness to it. But the disbelievers described it as a magical illusion add persisted in their denial. For this stubbornness they have been reproached in this Surah.

At the outset it has been said: "These people neither believe in the admonition, nor learn a lesson from history, nor affirm faith after witnessing manifest signs with their eyes. Now they would believe only when Resurrection has taken place and they would be rushing out of their graves towards the Summoner on that Day."

Then, the stories of the people of Noah and of 'Ad and Thamud and of the peoples of Lot and the Pharaoh have been related briefly and they have been reminded of the terrible punishments that these nations suffered when they belied and disregarded the warnings given by the Prophets of God. After the narration of each story the refrain that has been provided is : "This Qur'an is an easy means of admonition, which if a nation takes to heart and thereby takes the Right Way, the torment that descended on the former nations could be avoided. But it would indeed be a folly if instead of heeding the admonition through this easy means, one persisted in heedlessness and disbelieved until one was overtaken by the torment itself."

Likewise, after citing admonitory precedents from the history of the former nations, the disbelievers of Makkah have been addressed and warned to this effect: "If you too adopt the same attitude and conduct for which the other nations have already been punished, why will you not be punished for it?Are you in any way a superior people that you should be treated differently from others? Or, have you received a deed of amnesty that you will not be punished for the crime for which others have been punished?And if you feel elated at your great numbers, you will soon see that these very numbers of yours are put to rout (on the battlefield) and on the Day of Resurrection you will be dealt with even more severely."

In the end, the disbelievers have been told that Allah does not need to make lengthy preparations to bring about Resurrection. No sooner does He give a simple command for it than it will take place immediately. Like everything else the Universe and mankind also have a destiny. According to this destiny everything happens at its own appointed time. It cannot be so that whenever somebody gives a challenge, Resurrection is brought about in order to convince him. If you adopt rebellion because you do not see it coming, you will only be adding to your own distress and misfortune. For your record which is being prepared by Divine agents, has not left any misdeed of yours, great or small, unrecorded.
description: The surah that opens with the unnerving, cataclysmic sign of the end of the world coming and The Moon having split apart. It takes its name from verse 1 which mentions “the moon” (qamar), that here serves as a reference to the Day of Resurrection. The surah deals mainly with the punishment dealt out to previous generations of disbelievers. These are presented as a warning to the disbelievers of Mecca, with the refrain “is there anyone who will be admonished?” running throughout the surah. Finally the treatment of the disbelievers on the Day of Judgement is contrasted to the everlasting bliss the believers will enjoy.

Efendi Nahi.verse 54:1: U afrua Casti (Dita e Kijametit) dhe u ça Hëna!
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:2: E ata, sa herë shohin mrekulli, kthehen dhe thonë: “Magji e përhershme!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:3: Ata e përgënjeshtrojnë (të vërtetën) dhe pasojnë kënaqësitë e tyre, e çdo gjë, madje, është e caktuar.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:4: Dhe, u patën ardhë atyre, me të vërtetë, lajme të cilat shpiejnë frikë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:5: (Kur’ani është) dijeni e përsosur – por paralajmërimi nuk u bëri dobi,
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:6: andaj, shmangu prej tyre! Në Ditën kur do t’i thërret ta kasneci (ftuesi) në diçka të tmerrshme –
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:7: ata, me sy të përulur dalin nga varret, thua se janë karkaleca të shpërndarë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:8: duke shpejtuar kah kasneci, e atëherë thonë mohuesit: “Kjo është ditë e vështirë!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:9: Para tyre (mekkasve) ka përgënjeshtruar populli i Nuhut: mohonin robin Tonë (Nuhun) dhe thonin: “I çmendur!” – dhe e pengonin (në tregimin e Shpalljes).
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:10: Dhe, iu lut Zotit të vet: “Unë jam i mundur (prej popullit tim), andaj Më ndihmo!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:11: Dhe, Ne ia kemi hapur dyert e qiellit me ujë (shi) të rrëmbyeshëm,
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:12: dhe, i kemi hapur burimet e tokës, e u takuan ujërat për një veprim që ka qenë i caktuar.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:13: E, atë e bartëm (në barkën) prej dërrasave dhe gozhdave
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:14: e cila lundronte nën kujdesin Tonë, - ky ishte shpërblim për atë që ishte i përgënjeshtruar.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:15: Dhe, Ne atë e kemi lënë si dokument, e a ka kush që këshillohet (me të)?
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:16: dhe, çfarë ka qenë dënimi Im dhe paralajmërimet e Mia?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:17: Në të vërtetë, Ne Kur’anin e kemi bërë të lehtë për këshillim, – e a ka kush që këshillohet (me të)?
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:18: Dhe, Adi ka përgënjeshtruar (të vërtetën), - e çfarë ka qenë dënimi Im dhe paralajmërimet e Mia?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:19: Ne u dërguam atyre në një ditë fatkeqe frymë të stuhieshme – të pandërprerë –
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:20: e cila i nxirrte njerëzit (prej strehimeve të tyre), thuase të ishin rrënjë të shkulura të hurmeve,
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:21: e, çfarë ka qenë dënimi Im dhe paralajmërimet e Mia?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:22: Në të vërtetë, Ne, Kur’anin e kemi bërë të lehtë për këshillim, - e a ka kush që këshillohet (me të)?
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:23: Dhe Themudi i përgënjeshtroi paralajmëruesit Tonë –
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:24: ata thanë: “Vallë, a ta pasojmë një njeri nga mesi ynë?! Atëherë, ne, me të vërtetë, do të ishim në rrugë të humbur dhe të çmendur.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:25: Vallë, në mesin (e sa) prej nesh, t’i dërgohet Shpallja atij?! Jo, ai është gënjeshtar mendjemadh!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:26: Nesër (së shpejti), do ta dinë ata se kush është gënjeshtari mendjemadh!
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:27: Ne, do ta dërgojmë devën për t’i sprovuar, andaj priti ti ata dhe bëhu i durueshëm.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:28: Dhe, lajmëroi ata se uji do të ndahet në mes tyre e devës, në çdo racion (shujtë) do të jetë prezent (ai që e ka rendin)!
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:29: Ata e thirrën shokun e tyre, e ai mori guximin dhe e preu atë (devën) –
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:30: e, çfarë ka qenë dënimi Im dhe paralajmërimet e Mia?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:31: Ne e dërguam te ta një ulurimë e ata u bënë si sana e copëtuar në pleme,
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:32: në të vërtetë, Ne Kur’anin e kemi bërë të lehtë (të kuptueshëm) pë këshillim, e a ka kush që këshillohet (me të)?
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:33: Edhe populli i Lutit i ka përgënjeshtruar paralajmërimet.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:34: Ne, me të vërtetë, e kemi dërguar një fortunë mbi ta, pos në familjen e Lutit, këtë e shpëtuam në agim,
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:35: nga dhuntia Jonë. Ja, kështu Ne i shpërblejmë ata që falenderojnë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:36: Me të vërtetë, ai (Luti) i paralajmëroi ata me fuqinë e dënimit Tonë, e ata polemizuan duke i mohuar paralajmërimet.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:37: At aprej tij i kërkuan mysafirët e tij, e Ne ua fshimë sytë atyre (i verbuam): “Shijoni dënimin Tim dhe paralajmërimin Tim!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:38: E, të nesërmen në mëngjes, ata i goditi dënimi i përhershëm.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:40: Me të vërtetë, Ne Kur’anin e kemi bërë të lehtë për (ta mësuar përmendësh) këshillim, e a ka kush që këshillohet (me të)?
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:41: Edhe njerëzve të Faraonit u patën ardhur paralajmërimet,
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:42: por ata i mohuan të gjitha argumentet Tona, andaj Ne i dënuam ata, ashtu siç dënon i Plotëfuqishmi dhe i Plotëpushtetshmi.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:43: A mos vallë mohuesit tuaj (Mekkasit) janë më të mirë se ata (që u përmendën), apo ju keni ndonjë dekret në librat e shpallur?
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:44: Apo, ata thonë: “Ne jemi grup i pathyeshëm!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:45: Së shpejti do të thyhet grupi dhe me të vërtetë, mëkatarët do të jenë të humbur dhe në zjarr (në jetën tjetër) është më i tmerrshëm dhe më i idhët (se dënimi në këtë botë).
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:47: Me të vërtetë, mëkatarët do të jenë të humbur dhe në zjarr (në jetën tjetër).
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:48: Ditën që do të tërhiqen (me forcë) fytyrat e tyre në zjarr (e ju thuhet): “Shijoni zjarrin e xhehennemit!”
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:49: Ne, me të vërtetë, të gjitha i kemi krijuar sipas dispozitës,
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:50: Urdhëri Ynë është vetëm një fjalë (në kryerjen e punëve – i shpejtë) sa çel e mbyllë sytë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:51: E, Ne, madje i kemi shkatërruar të ngjashmit me ju, - e a ka kush që këshillohet (me të)?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:52: E, çkado që punojnë, ato janë në librat (e veprave të njerëzve)
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:53: të gjitha, të mëdha dhe të vogla, janë shënuar në rreshta.
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:54: Ata që i druajnë Perëndisë me të vërtetë, do të jenë në kopshtet e xhennetit dhe pranë lumenjve
Efendi Nahi.verse 54:55: në vendin e kënaqësisë, te Sunduesi i Plotëfuqishëm.

null.verse 54:6: Artıq (ya Peyğəmbər!) sən onlardan üz çevir. Carçının (İsrafilin) onları olduqca pis (dəhşətli) bir şeyə (məhşərə) çağıracağı günədək!
null.verse 54:7: Onlar (o gün) gözlərini zəlilanə aşağı tikib (ətrafa) səpələnmiş çəyirtkələr kimi qəbirlərindən çıxacaqlar.
null.verse 54:8: Kafirlər (boyunlarını qabağa uzadıb) carçıya tərəf tələsərək: "Bu nə çətin bir gündür!" - deyəcəklər.
null.verse 54:9: Bunlardan (Məkkə müşriklərindən) əvvəl Nuh qövmü (öz peyğəmbərini) təkzib etmiş və bəndəmizi (Nuhu) yalançı sayıb: "(Bu) divanədir!" - demişdilər. Ona (risaləti təbliğ etmək) qadağan edilmişdi.
null.verse 54:10: (Nuh) Rəbbinə dua edib: "Mən (öz qövmümüm içində) məğlub oldum, buna görə də (onlardan) intiqam al!" - dedi.
null.verse 54:11: Biz (onun duasını qəbul edərək) göyün qapılarını sel kimi axan bir yağışla açdıq.
null.verse 54:12: Yeri yarıb (oradan) bulaqlar qaynatdıq. Nəhayət, (göydən axan və yerdən qaynayan) sular (lövhi-məhfuzda) əzəldən müəyyən edilmiş bir iş üçün (tufan məqsədilə) bir-birinə qovuşdu.
null.verse 54:13: Biz Nuhu (ona iman gətirənlərlə birlikdə) taxtadan düzəlmiş və mismarlanmış gəmiyə mindirdik.
null.verse 54:14: (Qövmü tərəfindən) inkar edilmiş kimsəyə (Nuha) mükafat olaraq verilən (gəmi) gözümüzün qabağında (nəzarətimiz altında) üzüb gedirdi.
null.verse 54:15: And olsun ki, Biz onu (tufan hadisəsini, yaxud Nuh qövmünün başına gələnləri sonrakı nəsillərə) ibrət üçün saxladıq. Amma heç bir ibrət alan (öyüd-nəsihət qəbul edən) varmı?!
null.verse 54:16: Bir (görəydiniz) Mənim əzabım və qorxutmağım necə oldu!
null.verse 54:17: And olsun ki, Biz Qur'anı (ondan) ibrət almaq (öyüd-nəsihət qəbul etmək) üçün belə asanlaşdırdıq. Amma heç bir ibrət alan (öyüd-nəsihət qəbul edən) varmı?!
null.verse 54:18: Ad (qövmü də öz peyğəmbərinə) təkzib etmişdi. (Bir görəydiniz) Mənim əzabım və qorxutmağım necə oldu!
null.verse 54:19: Biz (əzabı) uzun sürən nəhs bir gündə onların üstünə uğultulu (çox soyuq) bir külək göndərdik.
null.verse 54:20: O, adamları kökündən qopmuş xurma kötükləri kimi (yerindən) qopardıb atırdı.
null.verse 54:21: (Bir görəydiniz) Mənim əzabım və qorxutmağım necə oldu!
null.verse 54:22: And olsun ki, Biz Qur'anı (ondan) ibrət almaq (öyüd-nəsihət qəbul etmək) üçün belə asanlaşdırdıq. Amma heç bir ibrət alan (öyüd-nəsihət qəbul edən) varmı?!
null.verse 54:23: Səmud (qövmü də Saleh peyğəmbərin onlara etdiyi) təhdidləri (xəbərdarlıqları) yalan saymışdı.
null.verse 54:24: Onlar demişdilər: "Məgər biz özümüzdən olan (adi) bir adamamı tabe olacağıq?! Biz onda haqq yoldan azmış və dəlilik etmiş olarıq!

null.verse 54:26: (Biz Saleh peyğəmbərə təsəlli verib dedik: ) "Onlara kimin yalançı, kimin lovğa olduğunu sabah mütləq biləcəklər!
null.verse 54:27: Biz onları imtahana çəkmək üçün bir dişi (maya) dəvə göndərəcəyik. Onların nə edəcəyini gözlə və (əziyyətlərinə də) döz!
null.verse 54:28: Və onlara suyun (dəvə ilə) onlar arasında bölüşdürüldüyünü xəbər ver! (Suyu bir gün onlar, bir gün də dəvə içəcəkdir). Hərə öz növbəsində hazır olsun!"
null.verse 54:29: Nəhayət, onlar öz yoldaşlarını (Qudar ibn Salifi) çağırdılar. O da (dəvəni) tutub kəsdi.
null.verse 54:30: (Bir görəydiniz) Mənim əzabım və qorxutmağım necə oldu!
null.verse 54:31: Biz onlara bircə dəhşətli (tükürpədici) səs (Cəbrailin qışqırtısını) göndərdik, dərhal (heyvanlar üçün) ağıl düzəldənin istifadə etdiyi quru ota (həşəmə) döndülər.
null.verse 54:32: And olsun ki, Biz Qur'anı (ondan) ibrət almaq (öyüd-nəsihət qəbul etmək) üçün belə asanlaşdırdıq. Amma heç bir ibrət alan (öyüd-nəsihət qəbul edən) varmı?!
null.verse 54:33: Lut qövmü də (peyğəmbərlərinin onlara etdiyi) təhdidləri (xəbərdarlıqları) yalan saymışdı.
null.verse 54:34: Biz də onların üstünə daş yağdıran yel göndərdik (başlarına daş yağdırdıq), yalnız Lutun ailəsini səhər çağı xilas etdik;
null.verse 54:35: Dərgahımızdan bir lütf olaraq! Biz (ne'mətimizə) şükür edəni belə mükafatlandırırıq!
null.verse 54:36: And olsun ki, (Lut) onları Bizim əzabımızla qorxutmuş, onlar isə bu təhdidlərə (xəbərdarlıqlara) şübhə edib inanmamışdılar.

null.verse 54:38: And olsun ki, səhər tezdən onları əbədi (qiyamətədək onlardan əl çəkməyən) bir əzab yaxaladı (məhv olub həmişəlik Cəhənnəmə vasil oldular).
null.verse 54:39: (Onlara: ) "İndi əzabımı və təhdidlərimi dadın!" (dedik).

null.verse 54:42: Onlar ayələrimizin (mö'cüzələrimizin) hamısını yalan hesab etdilər. Biz də onları yenilməz qüvvət, qarşısıalınmaz intiqam sahibinə yaraşan bir əzabla yaxaladıq.
null.verse 54:43: (Ey Qüreyş əhli!) Sizin kafirlərin onlardan nəyi yaxşıdır?! Yoxsa (əvvəlki ilahi) kitablarda sizin üçün bəraət (əzabdan qurtuluş hökmü) vardır?!

null.verse 54:45: (Bədr vuruşunda) bu dəstə mütləq məğlub olacaq və arxa çevirib qaçacaqdır!
null.verse 54:46: Xeyr, onların əsl əzab vaxtı qiyamət günüdür. Qiyamət gününün əzabı daha acıdır (daha şiddətlidir).

null.verse 54:49: Şübhəsiz ki, Biz hər şeyi müəyyən ölçüdə (lazım olduğu qədər) yaratdıq.
null.verse 54:50: Bizim buyurduğumuz bir göz qırpımında yerinə yetər! (Hər hansı bir şeyi yaratmaq istədikdə ona bircə dəfə: "Ol !" - deyərik, o da dərhal olar!)
null.verse 54:51: And olsun ki, Biz sizin kimiləri (çox) məhv etmişik. Amma heç bir ibrət alan (öyüd-nəsihət qəbul edən) varmı?!
null.verse 54:52: Onların etdiyi hər şey (əməllərinin yazıldığı) dəftərlərdədir!
null.verse 54:53: Hər bir kiçik və böyük (günah lövhi-məhfuzda) yazılmışdır!
null.verse 54:54: Şübhəsiz ki, müttəqilər (axirətdə) cənnət bağlarında və çaylar kənarında,
null.verse 54:55: (Heç bir yersiz söhbətə və günaha təhrik olunmayan) haqq məclisində, qadir hökmdarın (Allahın) hüzurunda olacaqlar!

null.verse 54:1: Bliži se Čas i Mjesec se raspolutio! -
null.verse 54:2: a oni, uvijek kada vide čudo, okreću glave i govore: "Čarolija neprestana!"
null.verse 54:3: Oni ne vjeruju i povode se za prohtjevima svojim, a sve je već određeno.
null.verse 54:4: i dolaze im vijesti koje ih trebaju odvratiti -
null.verse 54:5: mudrost savršena, ali opomene ne koriste,
null.verse 54:6: zato se okreni od njih! Na Dan kad ih glasnik pozove na nešto užasno
null.verse 54:7: oni će oborenih pogleda iz grobova izlaziti, kao skakavci rasuti,
null.verse 54:8: i netremice gledajući u glasnika i žureći, nevjernici će govoriti: "Ovo je težak dan!"
null.verse 54:9: Prije njih Nuhov narod nije vjerovao i roba Našeg je u laž utjerivao, govoreći: "Luđak!" - i Nuh je onemogućen bio.
null.verse 54:10: I on je Gospodara svoga zamolio: "Ja sam pobijeđen, Ti se osveti!"
null.verse 54:11: I Mi smo kapije nebeske pootvarali vodi koja je neprestano lila,
null.verse 54:12: i učinili da iz zemlje izvori provru, i vode su se sastajale kako je određeno bilo,
null.verse 54:13: a njega smo nosili na onoj od dasaka i klinaca sagrađenoj
null.verse 54:14: koja je plovila pod brigom Našom - nagrada je to bila za onoga ko je odbačen bio.
null.verse 54:15: I Mi to ostavismo kao pouku - pa ima li ikoga ko bi pouku primio?
null.verse 54:16: i kakve su bile kazna Moja i opomene Moje!
null.verse 54:17: A Mi smo Kur’an učinili dostupnim za pouku - pa ima li ikoga ko bi pouku primio?
null.verse 54:18: I Ad nije vjerovao - pa kakve su bile kazna Moja i opomene Moje!
null.verse 54:19: Jednog kobnog dana poslali smo na njih leden vjetar koji je neprestano puhao
null.verse 54:20: i ljude dizao, kao da su palmina stabla iščupana,
null.verse 54:21: i kakve su bile kazna Moja i opomene Moje!
null.verse 54:22: A Mi smo Kur’an učinili dostupnim za učenje napamet i pouku, pa ima li ikoga ko bi pouku primio?
null.verse 54:23: I Semud u opomene nije vjerovao.
null.verse 54:24: Zar da slijedimo jednog od nas! - govorili su. "Tada bismo, uistinu, bili u zabludi i bili bismo ludi.
null.verse 54:25: Zar baš njemu, između nas, da bude poslana Objava?! Ne, on je lažljivac oholi!"
null.verse 54:26: Vrlo brzo će oni saznati ko je lažljivac oholi!
null.verse 54:27: Mi ćemo poslati kamilu da bismo ih iskušali, pa pričekaj ih i budi strpljiv.
null.verse 54:28: I upozori ih da će se voda između njih i nje dijeliti, svakom obroku pristupiće onaj čiji je red!"
null.verse 54:29: Ali oni pozvaše jednog od svojih, pa se on spremi i prekla je -
null.verse 54:30: i kakve su bile kazna Moja i opomene Moje:
null.verse 54:31: Mi poslasmo na njih jedan jedini krik, i oni postadoše poput zdrobljenog suhog lišća koje sakuplja onaj koji ima tor.
null.verse 54:32: A Mi smo Kur’an učinili dostupnim za pouku, pa ima li ikoga ko bi pouku primio?
null.verse 54:33: I Lutov narod u opomene nije vjerovao.
null.verse 54:34: Na njih vjetar, pun pijeska, poslasmo - samo ne na Lutovu porodicu, nju u svitanje spasismo,
null.verse 54:35: iz milosti naše. Eto, tako Mi nagrađujemo one koji zahvaljuju.
null.verse 54:36: A on im je bio prijetio silom Našom, ali su oni u prijetnje sumnjali.
null.verse 54:37: Oni su od njega goste njegove tražili, pa smo ih Mi oslijepili: "Iskusite kaznu Moju i prijetnje Moje!"
null.verse 54:38: A rano izjutra stiže ih kazna koju će neprestano osjećati.
null.verse 54:39: Iskusite kaznu Moju i prijetnje Moje!
null.verse 54:40: A Mi smo Kur’an učinili dostupnim za učenje napamet i pouku, pa ima li ikoga ko bi pouku primio?!
null.verse 54:41: I faraonovim ljudima su opomene došle,
null.verse 54:42: ali oni porekoše dva značenja Naša, pa ih Mi kaznismo onako kako kažnjava Silni i Moćni.
null.verse 54:43: Da li su nevjernici vaši imalo jači od njih, ili vi u knjigama nebeskim imate kakvu povelju?
null.verse 54:44: Zar ovi da govore: "Mi smo skup nepobjedivi!"
null.verse 54:45: Skup će, sigurno, poražen biti, a oni će se u bijeg dati!
null.verse 54:46: Međutim, Smak svijeta im je rok, a Smak svijeta je užasniji i gorči.
null.verse 54:47: Grješnici će, sigurno, stradati i u ognju biti
null.verse 54:48: na Dan kada budu u vatru odvučeni, s licima dolje okrenutim: "Iskusite vatru džehennemsku!"
null.verse 54:49: Mi sve s mjerom stvaramo,
null.verse 54:50: i naređenje Naše je samo jedna riječ - sve bude u tren oka.
null.verse 54:51: A Mi smo već slične vama uništili, pa ima li koga ko bi pouku primio?!
null.verse 54:52: I sve što su uradili u listovima je,
null.verse 54:53: i sve, i malo i veliko, u retke je stavljeno.
null.verse 54:54: Oni koji su se Allaha bojali biće u džennetskim baščama i pored rijeka
null.verse 54:55: na mjestu u kome će biti zadovoljni, kod Vladara Svemoćnoga.

null.verse 54:1: কেয়ামত আসন্ন, চন্দ্র বিদীর্ণ হয়েছে।
null.verse 54:2: তারা যদি কোন নিদর্শন দেখে তবে মুখ ফিরিয়ে নেয় এবং বলে, এটা তো চিরাগত জাদু।
null.verse 54:3: তারা মিথ্যারোপ করছে এবং নিজেদের খেয়াল-খুশীর অনুসরণ করছে। প্রত্যেক কাজ যথাসময়ে স্থিরীকৃত হয়।
null.verse 54:4: তাদের কাছে এমন সংবাদ এসে গেছে, যাতে সাবধানবাণী রয়েছে।
null.verse 54:5: এটা পরিপূর্ণ জ্ঞান, তবে সতর্ককারীগণ তাদের কোন উপকারে আসে না।
null.verse 54:6: অতএব, আপনি তাদের থেকে মুখ ফিরিয়ে নিন। যেদিন আহবানকারী আহবান করবে এক অপ্রিয় পরিণামের দিকে,
null.verse 54:7: তারা তখন অবনমিত নেত্রে কবর থেকে বের হবে বিক্ষিপ্ত পংগপাল সদৃশ।
null.verse 54:8: তারা আহবানকারীর দিকে দৌড়াতে থাকবে। কাফেরা বলবেঃ এটা কঠিন দিন।
null.verse 54:9: তাদের পূর্বে নূহের সম্প্রদায়ও মিথ্যারোপ করেছিল। তারা মিথ্যারোপ করেছিল আমার বান্দা নূহের প্রতি এবং বলেছিলঃ এ তো উম্মাদ। তাঁরা তাকে হুমকি প্রদর্শন করেছিল।
null.verse 54:10: অতঃপর সে তার পালনকর্তাকে ডেকে বললঃ আমি অক্ষম, অতএব, তুমি প্রতিবিধান কর।
null.verse 54:11: তখন আমি খুলে দিলাম আকাশের দ্বার প্রবল বারিবর্ষণের মাধ্যমে।
null.verse 54:12: এবং ভুমি থেকে প্রবাহিত করলাম প্রস্রবণ। অতঃপর সব পানি মিলিত হল এক পরিকম্পিত কাজে।
null.verse 54:13: আমি নূহকে আরোহণ করালাম এক কাষ্ঠ ও পেরেক নির্মিত জলযানে।
null.verse 54:14: যা চলত আমার দৃষ্টি সামনে। এটা তার পক্ষ থেকে প্রতিশোধ ছিল, যাকে প্রত্যখ্যান করা হয়েছিল।
null.verse 54:15: আমি একে এক নিদর্শনরূপে রেখে দিয়েছি। অতএব, কোন চিন্তাশীল আছে কি?
null.verse 54:16: কেমন কঠোর ছিল আমার শাস্তি ও সতর্কবাণী।
null.verse 54:17: আমি কোরআনকে সহজ করে দিয়েছি বোঝার জন্যে। অতএব, কোন চিন্তাশীল আছে কি?
null.verse 54:18: আদ সম্প্রদায় মিথ্যারোপ করেছিল, অতঃপর কেমন কঠোর হয়েছিল আমার শাস্তি ও সতর্কবাণী।
null.verse 54:19: আমি তাদের উপর প্রেরণ করেছিলাম ঝঞ্জাবায়ু এক চিরাচরিত অশুভ দিনে।
null.verse 54:20: তা মানুষকে উৎখাত করছিল, যেন তারা উৎপাটিত খর্জুর বৃক্ষের কান্ড।
null.verse 54:21: অতঃপর কেমন কঠোর ছিল আমার শাস্তি ও সতর্কবাণী।
null.verse 54:22: আমি কোরআনকে বোঝার জন্যে সহজ করে দিয়েছি। অতএব, কোন চিন্তাশীল আছে কি?
null.verse 54:23: সামুদ সম্প্রদায় সতর্ককারীদের প্রতি মিথ্যারোপ করেছিল।
null.verse 54:24: তারা বলেছিলঃ আমরা কি আমাদেরই একজনের অনুসরণ করব? তবে তো আমরা বিপথগামী ও বিকার গ্রস্থরূপে গণ্য হব।
null.verse 54:25: আমাদের মধ্যে কি তারই প্রতি উপদেশ নাযিল করা হয়েছে? বরং সে একজন মিথ্যাবাদী, দাম্ভিক।
null.verse 54:26: এখন আগামীকল্যই তারা জানতে পারবে কে মিথ্যাবাদী, দাম্ভিক।
null.verse 54:27: আমি তাদের পরীক্ষার জন্য এক উষ্ট্রী প্রেরণ করব, অতএব, তাদের প্রতি লক্ষ্য রাখ এবং সবর কর।
null.verse 54:28: এবং তাদেরকে জানিয়ে দাও যে, তাদের মধ্যে পানির পালা নির্ধারিত হয়েছে এবং পালাক্রমে উপস্থিত হতে হবে।
null.verse 54:29: অতঃপর তারা তাদের সঙ্গীকে ডাকল। সে তাকে ধরল এবং বধ করল।
null.verse 54:30: অতঃপর কেমন কঠোর ছিল আমার শাস্তি ও সতর্কবাণী।
null.verse 54:31: আমি তাদের প্রতি একটিমাত্র নিনাদ প্রেরণ করেছিলাম। এতেই তারা হয়ে গেল শুষ্ক শাখাপল্লব নির্মিত দলিত খোয়াড়ের ন্যায়।
null.verse 54:32: আমি কোরআনকে বোঝার জন্যে সহজ করে দিয়েছি। অতএব, কোন চিন্তাশীল আছে কি?
null.verse 54:33: লূত-সম্প্রদায় সতর্ককারীদের প্রতি মিথ্যারোপ করেছিল।
null.verse 54:34: আমি তাদের প্রতি প্রেরণ করেছিলাম প্রস্তর বর্ষণকারী প্রচন্ড ঘূর্ণিবায়ু; কিন্তু লূত পরিবারের উপর নয়। আমি তাদেরকে রাতের শেষপ্রহরে উদ্ধার করেছিলাম।
null.verse 54:35: আমার পক্ষ থেকে অনুগ্রহ স্বরূপ। যারা কৃতজ্ঞতা স্বীকার করে, আমি তাদেরকে এভাবে পুরস্কৃত করে থকি।
null.verse 54:36: লূত (আঃ) তাদেরকে আমার প্রচন্ড পাকড়াও সম্পর্কে সতর্ক করেছিল। অতঃপর তারা সতর্কবাণী সম্পর্কে বাকবিতন্ডা করেছিল।
null.verse 54:37: তারা লূতের (আঃ) কাছে তার মেহমানদেরকে দাবী করেছিল। তখন আমি তাদের চক্ষু লোপ করে দিলাম। অতএব, আস্বাদন কর আমার শাস্তি ও সতর্কবাণী।
null.verse 54:38: তাদেরকে প্রত্যুষে নির্ধারিত শাস্তি আঘাত হেনেছিল।
null.verse 54:39: অতএব, আমার শাস্তি ও সতর্কবাণী আস্বাদন কর।
null.verse 54:40: আমি কোরআনকে বোঝবার জন্যে সহজ করে দিয়েছি। অতএব, কোন চিন্তাশীল আছে কি?
null.verse 54:41: ফেরাউন সম্প্রদায়ের কাছেও সতর্ককারীগণ আগমন করেছিল।
null.verse 54:42: তারা আমার সকল নিদর্শনের প্রতি মিথ্যারোপ করেছিল। অতঃপর আমি পরাভূতকারী, পরাক্রমশালীর ন্যায় তাদেরকে পাকড়াও করলাম।
null.verse 54:43: তোমাদের মধ্যকার কাফেররা কি তাদের চাইতে শ্রেষ্ঠ ? না তোমাদের মুক্তির সনদপত্র রয়েছে কিতাবসমূহে?
null.verse 54:44: না তারা বলে যে, আমারা এক অপরাজেয় দল?
null.verse 54:45: এ দল তো সত্ত্বরই পরাজিত হবে এবং পৃষ্ঠপ্রদর্শন করবে।
null.verse 54:46: বরং কেয়ামত তাদের প্রতিশ্রুত সময় এবং কেয়ামত ঘোরতর বিপদ ও তিক্ততর।
null.verse 54:47: নিশ্চয় অপরাধীরা পথভ্রষ্ট ও বিকারগ্রস্ত।
null.verse 54:48: যেদিন তাদেরকে মুখ হিঁচড়ে টেনে নেয়া হবে জাহান্নামে, বলা হবেঃ অগ্নির খাদ্য আস্বাদন কর।
null.verse 54:49: আমি প্রত্যেক বস্তুকে পরিমিতরূপে সৃষ্টি করেছি।
null.verse 54:50: আমার কাজ তো এক মুহূর্তে চোখের পলকের মত।
null.verse 54:51: আমি তোমাদের সমমনা লোকদেরকে ধ্বংস করেছি, অতএব, কোন চিন্তাশীল আছে কি?
null.verse 54:52: তারা যা কিছু করেছে, সবই আমলনামায় লিপিবদ্ধ আছে।
null.verse 54:53: ছোট ও বড় সবই লিপিবদ্ধ।
null.verse 54:54: খোদাভীরুরা থাকবে জান্নাতে ও নির্ঝরিণীতে।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:1: Наближи Часът и се разцепи луната.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:2: Но и да видят знамение, те се отдръпват и казват: Продължителна магия.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:3: И го взимат за лъжа, и следват своите страсти. Но за всяко дело има край.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:4: Дойдоха вече при тях вести, които да ги възпират,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:5: зряла мъдрост [- Коранът] - ала безполезни са за тях предупредителите.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:6: Затова се отвърни от тях [о, Мухаммад]! В Деня, когато зовящият призове към нещо ужасно,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:7: те със сведен поглед ще излязат от гробовете като пръснати скакалци,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:8: забързани към зовящия. Ще кажат неверниците: Това е тежък Ден.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:9: Отричаше преди тях и народът на Нух. Отричаха Нашия раб и казваха: Той е луд!, и бе прогонен с крясъци.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:10: Тогава призова той своя Господ: Аз съм победен, помогни ми!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:11: И разтворихме Ние вратите на небето със струяща вода,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:12: и сторихме да бликнат извори от земята, и водите се срещнаха за предопределена повеля.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:13: А него понесохме върху [Ковчега от] дъски и гвоздеи,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:14: плаващ пред Очите Ни - въздаяние за онзи, който бе отричан.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:15: И оставихме това за знамение, но има ли кой да се поучи?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:16: И какво бе Моето мъчение и Моето предупреждение!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:17: И сторихме Корана лесен за поучение, но има ли кой да се поучи?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:18: И адитите отричаха. И какво бе Моето мъчение и Моето предупреждение!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:19: Изпратихме срещу тях вихър в ден на непрестанно злочестие,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:20: изтръгващ хората, сякаш са стволове на изскубнати палми.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:21: И какво бе Моето мъчение и Моето предупреждение!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:22: И сторихме Корана лесен за поучение, но има ли кой да се поучи?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:24: И рекоха: Нима човек от нас ще последваме? Тогава ние ще изпаднем в заблуда и безумие.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:25: Нима на него бе разкрито Поучението сред нас? Не, той е надменен лъжец.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:26: Утре ще научат кой е надменен лъжец.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:27: Изпращаме Ние камилата като изпитание за тях. Наблюдавай ги и търпи!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:28: И ги извести, че водата е поделена между [нея и] тях! И пиенето на всеки е разпределено.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:29: Но извикаха техен другар и той се зае, и я закла.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:30: И какво бе Моето мъчение и Моето предупреждение!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:31: Изпратихме срещу тях само един Вик и станаха като сухите сламки на сеното.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:32: И сторихме Корана лесен за поучение, но има ли кой да се поучи?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:33: И народът на Лут отричаше предупредителите.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:34: Изпратихме срещу тях ураган от камъни, освен за семейството на Лут. Спасихме ги на развиделяване -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:35: благодеяние от Нас. Така въздаваме на онзи, който е признателен.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:36: Той ги предупреди за Нашето мъчение, но те се усъмниха в предупреждението.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:37: И поискаха от него да ги допусне до гостите си, но ослепихме очите им. Вкусете Моето мъчение и Моето предупреждение!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:38: И рано сутринта ги сполетя трайно мъчение.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:39: Вкусете Моето мъчение и Моето предупреждение!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:40: И сторихме Корана лесен за поучение, но има ли кой да се поучи?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:41: Предупредителите дойдоха и при хората на Фараона,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:42: [но] те взеха за лъжа всичките Ни знамения. Затова ги сграбчихме, както подобава на всесилен, всемогъщ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:43: Нима вашите неверници са по-добри от онези, или за вас има оневиняване в Писанията?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:44: Или казват: Не сме ли ние непобедимо множество?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:45: Ще бъде разгромено множеството и ще обърне то гръб в бяг.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:46: Часът е обещаният им срок. Часът е най-злочестият и най-горчивият.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:47: Престъпниците ще са в заблуда и безумие
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:48: в Деня, когато бъдат влачени по лице в Огъня: Вкусете допира на Ада!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:49: Ние всяко нещо сътворихме с мяра.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:50: Нашата повеля се изпълнява, докато мигне окото.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:51: Вече погубихме подобните на вас. Но има ли кой да се поучи?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:52: И всяко нещо, което са вършили, го има в писанията.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:53: Всичко, малко или голямо, е записано.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 54:54: Богобоязливите ще пребъдат сред градини и реки -

null.verse 54:1: 復活時臨近了，月亮破裂了。
null.verse 54:2: 如果他們看見一種蹟象，他們就退避，而且說：「這是一種有力的魔術。」
null.verse 54:3: 他們否認他，而且順從私欲。每一件事都是確定的。
null.verse 54:4: 包含警戒的許多消息，確已來臨他們了，
null.verse 54:5: 那是極精密的智慧；但警告是無效的，
null.verse 54:6: 故你應當避開他們。當召喚者召人於難事的日子，
null.verse 54:7: 他們不敢仰視地由墳中出來，好像是遍地的蝗蟲；
null.verse 54:8: 大家引頸而奔，群集於召喚者的面前。不信道的人們將說：「這是一個煩難的日子！」
null.verse 54:9: 在他們之前，努哈的宗族否認過，他們否認過我的僕人，他們說：「這是一個瘋人。」他曾被喝斥，
null.verse 54:10: 故他祈禱他的主說：「我確是被壓迫的，求你相助吧！」
null.verse 54:11: 我就以傾注的雨水開了許多天門，
null.verse 54:12: 我又使大地上的泉源湧出；雨水和泉水，就依既定的狀況而匯合。
null.verse 54:13: 我使他乘坐一隻用木板和釘子製造的船上，
null.verse 54:14: 在我的眷顧之下飄流，以報答被人否認者。
null.verse 54:15: 我確已將這件事留作一種蹟象，有接受勸告者嗎？
null.verse 54:16: 我的刑罰和警告是怎樣的！
null.verse 54:17: 我確已使《古蘭經》易於記誦，有接受勸告的人嗎？
null.verse 54:18: 阿德人否認過先知，我的刑罰和警告是怎樣的！
null.verse 54:19: 我確已使暴風在一個很兇惡的日子去毀滅他們，
null.verse 54:20: 暴風將眾人拔起，他們好像被拔出的海棗樹幹一樣。
null.verse 54:21: 我的刑罰和警告是怎樣的！
null.verse 54:22: 我確已使《古蘭經》易於記誦，有接受勸告的人嗎？
null.verse 54:23: 賽莫德人否認過警告，
null.verse 54:24: 故他們說：「我們同族的一個凡人，我們能順從他嗎？如果那樣，我們必定陷於迷誤和瘋狂之中。
null.verse 54:25: 難道他們在我們之間獨自奉到啟示嗎？不然，他是說謊者，是傲慢者。」
null.verse 54:26: 他們明日將知道誰是說謊者，誰是傲慢者。
null.verse 54:27: 我必定使母駝考驗他們，故你應當期待他們，並應當堅忍，
null.verse 54:28: 你應當告訴他們，井水是他們和母駝所均分的，應得水份的，輪流著到井邊來。
null.verse 54:29: 他們曾喊來他們的朋友，他就拿起劍來宰了母駝。
null.verse 54:30: 我的刑罰和警告是怎樣的！
null.verse 54:31: 我確以使一種爆炸去毀滅他們，他們就變成造圈欄者所用的枯木。
null.verse 54:32: 我確已使《古蘭經》易於記誦，有接受勸告的人嗎？
null.verse 54:33: 魯特的宗族曾否認警告，
null.verse 54:34: 我確已使飛沙走石的暴風去毀滅他們；惟魯特的信徒，我在黎明時拯救了他們。
null.verse 54:35: 那是從我的主那裡發出的恩典，我如此報酬感謝者。
null.verse 54:36: 他確已將我的懲治警告他們，但他們以懷疑的態度否認警告。
null.verse 54:37: 他們確已誘惑他，叫他不要保護他的客人，但我塗抹了他們的眼睛。你們嘗試我的刑罰和警告吧！
null.verse 54:38: 一種永恆的刑罰在早晨確已襲擊了他們。
null.verse 54:39: 你們嘗試我的刑罰和警告吧！
null.verse 54:40: 我確已使《古蘭經》易於記誦，有接受勸告的人嗎？
null.verse 54:41: 警告確已降臨法老的百姓，
null.verse 54:42: 他們否認了我的一切蹟象，故我以萬能者全能者的態度，懲治了他們。
null.verse 54:43: 你們中不信道的人們比這等人還優秀呢？還是天經中有關於你們的赦條呢？
null.verse 54:44: 難道他們說：「我們是一個常勝的團體。」
null.verse 54:45: 那個團體將敗北，他們將轉背。
null.verse 54:46: 不然，復活時是他們的約期；復活時是更艱難的，是更辛苦的。
null.verse 54:47: 犯罪者的確在迷誤和烈火中。
null.verse 54:48: 他們匍匐著被拖入火獄之日，將對他們說：「你們嘗試火獄的燒灼吧！」
null.verse 54:49: 我確已依定量而創造萬物，
null.verse 54:50: 我的命令只是快如轉瞬的一句話。
null.verse 54:51: 我確已將你們的宗派毀滅了。有接受勸告的人嗎？
null.verse 54:52: 凡他們所做的事，都記載在天經中。
null.verse 54:53: 一切小事和大事，都是被記錄的。
null.verse 54:54: 敬畏的人們，必定在樂園裡，在光明中，
null.verse 54:55: 在全能的主那裡，得居一個如意的地位。

null.verse 54:1: Blíží se hodina a měsíc se rozpoltí.
null.verse 54:2: Když nevěřící znamení vidí, odvracejí se a říkají: "Kouzlo ustavičné!"
null.verse 54:3: A za lež je prohlašují a své vášně následují, však ustanovení každé je neměnné.
null.verse 54:4: A věru dostalo se jim již některých zvěstí, jež výstrahy obsahují
null.verse 54:5: i moudrost dokonalou. Však nic platné není varování!
null.verse 54:6: Odvrať se od nich tedy! V den, kdy svolavatel zavolá k věci strašné,
null.verse 54:7: se sklopeními zraky vystoupí z hrobů svých jak kobylky rozptýlené,
null.verse 54:8: krky ke svolavateli natažené! A řeknou nevěřící: "Toto věru těžký je den!"
null.verse 54:9: A již před nimi lid Noemův znamení za výmysl pokládal a Našeho služebníka za lháře prohlásil; i řekli oni: "Blázen!" a on byl jimi odstrašen.
null.verse 54:10: Pána svého vzýval: "Pomoz mi, jsem přemožen!"
null.verse 54:11: A brány nebeské jsme otevřeli pro vodu tekoucí proudem
null.verse 54:12: a ze země vytrysknout jsme dali pramenům, až setkaly se oba proudy dle rozkazu, jenž byl již předurčen.
null.verse 54:13: A naložili jsme Noeho na loď postavenou z prken a palmových vláken,
null.verse 54:14: aby plula pod naším zrakem v odměnu tomu, jenž byl tak odvržen.
null.verse 54:15: A ponechali jsme ji jako znamení. Což není nikoho, kdo připomněl by si to nyní?
null.verse 54:16: A jaký byl Můj trest a Mé varování?
null.verse 54:17: A učinili jsme Korán snadným pro připomínání; což není nikoho, kdo připomněl by si to nyní?
null.verse 54:18: A také ´Ádovci prohlásili za lež Naše znamení a jaký byl Můj trest a Mé varování?
null.verse 54:19: A vyslali jsme proti nim vítr svištivý v den neblahý, nekonečný,
null.verse 54:20: jenž lidi vytrhával tak, že byli jak palem vyvrácených kmeny.
null.verse 54:21: A jaký byl Můj trest a Mé varování?
null.verse 54:22: A učinili jsme Korán snadným pro připomínání; což není nikoho, kdo připomněl by si to nyní?
null.verse 54:23: A rovněž Thamúdovci varování za lživé pokládali
null.verse 54:24: a řekli: "Máme snad následovat smrtelníka z nás vzešlého? To bychom zbloudilí a pošetilí byli!
null.verse 54:25: Jak to, že zrovna jemu ze všech nás bylo připomenutí svrženo? Ba nikoliv, on lhář je opovážlivý!"
null.verse 54:26: Však zítra se dozvědí, kdo lhář byl opovážlivý!
null.verse 54:27: My k nim věru pošleme velbloudici jako pokušení jejich, a ty je trpělivě pozoruj
null.verse 54:28: a oznam jim, že voda je mezi ně rozdělena a napití každé má čas svůj.
null.verse 54:29: I zavolali svého druha, ten ruku vztáhl a velbloudici zahubil.
null.verse 54:30: A jaký byl Můj trest a Mé varování?
null.verse 54:31: A poslali jsme na ně jen výkřik jediný a stali se podobnými slámě suché, z níž ohrada se staví.
null.verse 54:32: A učinili jsme Korán snadným pro připomínání; což není nikoho, kdo připomněl by si to nyní?
null.verse 54:33: Za lživé soukmenovci Lotovi varování prohlásili,
null.verse 54:34: a poslali jsme vítr kamení nesoucí proti nim - kromě rodu Lotova, jejž za jitra jsme zachránili
null.verse 54:35: z milosti Své. A takto odměňujeme ty, kdož vděčnost projevili.
null.verse 54:36: Ačkoliv Lot je varoval před Naší přísností, oni pochybovali o varování
null.verse 54:37: a přáli si jeho hosty svést, však oči jejich jsme oslepili: "Okuste trestu Mého a varování!"
null.verse 54:38: A nazítří zrána je zasáhl trest trvalý.
null.verse 54:39: Okuste trestu Mého a varování!
null.verse 54:40: A učinili jsme Korán snadným pro připomínání; což není nikoho, kdo připomněl by si to nyní?
null.verse 54:41: A věru dostalo se i rodu Faraónovu varování,
null.verse 54:42: však za lež prohlásili všechna Naše znamení a uchvátili jsme je tak, jak mocný a všemohoucí činí.
null.verse 54:43: Jsou snad vaši nevěřící silnější, než byli tamti či bylo vám v Písmech zaručeno bezpečí?
null.verse 54:44: Anebo řeknou snad: "My jsme shromáždění vítězící."
null.verse 54:45: Však toto shromáždění na útěk bude obráceno a zády se otočí.
null.verse 54:46: Ba ano! Hodina bude časem schůzky jejich, Hodina velmi záludná a hořce chutnající.
null.verse 54:47: A hříšníci věru budou v pošetilosti a v bloudění,
null.verse 54:48: a v den, kdy budou tváří k zemi vlečeni, zvoláno bude: "Ochutnejte Saqaru pohlazení!"
null.verse 54:49: A každou věc jsme vskutku v určených rozměrech stvořili
null.verse 54:50: a rozkaz náš je pouze slovo jediné, rychlé jak oka mžiknutí.
null.verse 54:51: A vskutku jsme již zahubili jiné vám podobné. Což není nikoho, kdo připomněl by si to nyní?
null.verse 54:52: A vše, co konali, je v Písmech zapsáno
null.verse 54:53: a vše, ať malé či velké, je v nich zaznamenáno.
null.verse 54:54: A bohabojní věru budou mezi zahradami a řekami,
null.verse 54:55: v příbytku pravdy, u vládce všemohoucího!

null.verse 54:1: Het Uur is nabij, en de Maan is opengespleten.
null.verse 54:2: Maar als zij (de ongelovigen) een teken zien wenden zij zich er van af en zeggen: "Een voortdurende toverkunst."
null.verse 54:3: Zij verloochenen en volgen hun eigen begeerten. Maar elke verordening (Gods) zal plaats hebben.
null.verse 54:4: En er zijn reeds tijdingen tot hen gekomen waarin een waarschuwing ligt.
null.verse 54:5: Volmaakte wijsheid; maar de waarschuwingen helpen hen niet.
null.verse 54:6: Wend u daarom van hen af. De Dag waarop de aankondiger hen zal roepen tot iets onaangenaams,
null.verse 54:7: Dan zullen zij met nedergeslagen ogen uit hun graven komen als verstrooide sprinkhanen,
null.verse 54:8: Zich naar de omroeper haastend. De ongelovigen zullen zeggen "Dit is een moeilijke dag."
null.verse 54:9: Vóór hen verloochende het volk van Noach, zij verloochenden Onze dienaar en zeiden: "Een waanzinnige." En hij werd verdreven.
null.verse 54:10: Daarom bad hij tot zijn Heer: "Ik ben gewis verslagen, sta mij bij."
null.verse 54:11: Toen openden Wij de poorten van de hemel voor het stromende water.
null.verse 54:12: En Wij spleten de aarde door bronnen, waar door de wateren elkander ontmoetten volgens een vastgesteld plan.
null.verse 54:13: En Wij droegen hem op iets, bestaande uit planken en spijkers.
null.verse 54:14: Het dreef onder Onze ogen voort als een beloning voor hem, die verworpen was.
null.verse 54:15: En Wij maakten dit tot een teken. Is er iemand die er lering uit trekt?
null.verse 54:16: Hoe vreselijk was Mijn straf en Mijn waarschuwing!
null.verse 54:17: En Wij hebben inderdaad de Koran gemakkelijk gemaakt ter vermaning. Is er iemand die er lering uit trekt?
null.verse 54:18: Aad verloochende eveneens. Hoe (ernstig) was Mijn straf en Mijn waarschuwing!
null.verse 54:19: Wij zonden een woedende wind tegen hen, op een kwade, onvergetelijke dag.
null.verse 54:20: Die mensen wegtrok als waren zij de stammen van ontwortelde palmbomen.
null.verse 54:21: Hoe groot was toen Mijn straf en Mijn waarschuwing!
null.verse 54:22: En Wij hebben inderdaad de Koran gemakkelijk gemaakt ter vermaning. Is er iemand die er lering uit trekt?
null.verse 54:23: Ook (het volk van) Samoed verloochende de waarschuwers.
null.verse 54:24: En zij zeiden: "Moeten wij een man uit ons midden volgen? Dan zouden wij inderdaad verdwaald en krankzinnig zijn.
null.verse 54:25: Is de vermaning hem alleen gegeven? Neen, hij is een grote leugenaar en misdadiger."
null.verse 54:26: Morgen zullen zij weten wie de grote leugenaar en misdadiger is!
null.verse 54:27: Wij zullen de kameel zenden om hen op de proef te stellen. Let daarom op hen en heb geduld.
null.verse 54:28: En zeg hun, dat het water tussen hen is verdeeld en dat de tijd van elke drinkbeurt in acht moet worden genomen.
null.verse 54:29: Maar zij riepen hun metgezel, deze nam het (kameel) en verlamde het.
null.verse 54:30: Hoe vreselijk was toen Mijn straf en Mijn waarschuwing!
null.verse 54:31: Wij zonden een enkele straf tegen hen en zij werden als droog, vertrapt stro.
null.verse 54:32: En Wij hebben inderdaad de Koran gemakkelijk gemaakt ter vermaning. Is er iemand die er lering uit trekt?
null.verse 54:33: Het volk van Lot verloochende de waarschuwers ook.
null.verse 54:34: En Wij zonden een storm van stenen over hen allen met uitzondering van de familie van Lot, die Wij bij de dageraad verlosten,
null.verse 54:35: Als een gunst van Ons. Zo belonen Wij hen die dank betuigen.
null.verse 54:36: En Lot had hen inderdaad voor Onze straf gewaarschuwd doch zij trokken de waarschuwingen in twijfel.
null.verse 54:37: En zij trachtten hem van zijn gasten af te keren. Daarom verblindden Wij hun ogen en zeiden: "Ondergaat nu Mijn straf en Mijn waarschuwing."
null.verse 54:38: En de volgende morgen vroeg kwam er een blijvende straf over hen.
null.verse 54:39: "Ondergaat nu Mijn straf en Mijn waarschuwing."
null.verse 54:40: En Wij hebben inderdaad de Koran gemakkelijk gemaakt ter vermaning. Is er iemand die er lering uit trekt?
null.verse 54:41: Er kwamen ook waarschuwers tot het volk van Pharao.
null.verse 54:42: Zij verwierpen al Onze tekenen, daarom grepen Wij hen gelijk het grijpen van een krachtige en machtige.
null.verse 54:43: Zijn uw ongelovigen beter dan dezen? Of zijt gij vrijgesteld in de geschriften?
null.verse 54:44: Zeggen zij: "Wij zijn een overwinnende schare?"
null.verse 54:45: De scharen zullen allen op de vlucht worden gejaagd en zij zullen hun rug tonen.
null.verse 54:46: Neen, het Uur is hun vastgestelde tijd en het Uur zal uiterst rampzalig en bitter zijn.
null.verse 54:47: Voorzeker, de overtreders zullen in dwaling verkeren en zich in een vlammend Vuur bevinden.
null.verse 54:48: De Dag, waarop zij met hun aangezicht in het Vuur zullen worden gesleurd, zal er tot hen worden gezegd: "Voelt de aanraking der hel."
null.verse 54:49: Voorwaar, Wij hebben alles naar maat geschapen.
null.verse 54:50: En Ons gebod komt in één oogwenk.
null.verse 54:51: En Wij hebben inderdaad uw gelijken vernietigd. Is er iemand die er lering uit trekt?
null.verse 54:52: En al hetgeen zij deden staat in de geschriften.
null.verse 54:53: En alles, groot of klein, is nedergeschreven.
null.verse 54:54: Voorwaar, de rechtvaardigen zullen te midden van tuinen en rivieren zijn.
null.verse 54:55: Op de juiste plaats in de tegenwoordigheid van de Almachtige Koning.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:1: The hour drew nigh and the moon was rent in twain.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:2: And if they behold a portent they turn away and say: Prolonged illusion.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:3: They denied (the Truth) and followed their own lusts. Yet everything will come to a decision
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:4: And surely there hath come unto them news whereof the purport should deter,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:5: Effective wisdom; but warnings avail not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:6: So withdraw from them (O Muhammad) on the day when the Summoner summoneth unto a painful thing.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:7: With downcast eyes, they come forth from the graves as they were locusts spread abroad,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:8: Hastening toward the summoner; the disbelievers say: This is a hard day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:9: The folk of Noah denied before them, yea, they denied Our slave and said: A madman; and he was repulsed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:10: So he cried unto his Lord, saying: I am vanquished, so give help.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:11: Then opened We the gates of heaven with pouring water
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:12: And caused the earth to gush forth springs, so that the waters met for a predestined purpose.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:13: And We carried him upon a thing of planks and nails,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:14: That ran (upon the waters) in Our sight, as a reward for him who was rejected.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:15: And verily We left it as a token; but is there any that remembereth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:16: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:17: And in truth We have made the Qur’an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:18: (The tribe of) A’ad rejected warnings. Then how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:19: Lo! We let loose on them a raging wind on a day of constant calamity,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:20: Sweeping men away as though they were uprooted trunks of palm-trees.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:21: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:22: And in truth We have made the Qur’an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:24: For they said; Is it a mortal man, alone among us, that we are to follow ? Then indeed we should fall into error and madness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:25: Hath the remembrance been given unto him alone among us ? Nay, but he is a rash liar.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:26: (Unto their warner it was said): To-morrow they will know who is the rash liar.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:27: Lo! We are sending the she-camel as a test for them; so watch them and have patience;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:28: And inform them that the water is to be shared between (her and) them. Every drinking will be witnessed.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:29: But they call their comrade and he took and hamstrung (her).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:30: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:31: Lo! We sent upon them one Shout, and they became as the dry twigs (rejected by) the builder of a cattle-fold.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:32: And in truth We have made the Qur’an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:33: The folk of Lot rejected warnings.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:34: Lo! We sent a storm of stones upon them (all) save the family of Lot, whom We rescued in the last watch of the night,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:35: As grace from Us. Thus We reward him who giveth thanks.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:36: And he indeed had warned them of Our blow, but they did doubt the warnings.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:37: They even asked of him his guests for an ill purpose. Then We blinded their eyes (and said): Taste now My punishment after My warnings!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:38: And in truth the punishment decreed befell them early in the morning.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:39: Now taste My punishment after My warnings!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:40: And in truth We have made the Qur’an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:41: And warnings came in truth unto the house of Pharaoh
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:42: Who denied Our revelations, every one. Therefore We grasped them with the grasp of the Mighty, the Powerful.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:43: Are your disbelievers better than those, or have ye some immunity in the scriptures ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:44: Or say they: We are a host victorious ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:45: The hosts will all be routed and will turn and flee.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:46: Nay, but the Hour (of doom) is their appointed tryst, and the Hour will be more wretched and more bitter (than their earthly failure).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:47: Lo! the guilty are in error and madness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:48: On the day when they are dragged into the Fire upon their faces (it is said unto them): Feel the touch of hell.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:49: Lo! We have created every thing by measure.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:50: And Our commandment is but one (commandment), as the twinkling of an eye.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:51: And verily We have destroyed your fellows; but is there any that remembereth ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:52: And every thing they did is in the scriptures,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:53: And every small and great thing is recorded.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:54: Lo! the righteous will dwell among gardens and rivers,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 54:55: Firmly established in the favour of a Mighty King.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:1: The Hour (of Judgment) is nigh, and the moon is cleft asunder.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:2: But if they see a Sign, they turn away, and say, "This is (but) transient magic."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:3: They reject (the warning) and follow their (own) lusts but every matter has its appointed time.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:4: There have already come to them Recitals wherein there is (enough) to check (them),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:5: Mature wisdom;- but (the preaching of) Warners profits them not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:6: Therefore, (O Prophet,) turn away from them. The Day that the Caller will call (them) to a terrible affair,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:7: They will come forth,- their eyes humbled - from (their) graves, (torpid) like locusts scattered abroad,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:8: Hastening, with eyes transfixed, towards the Caller!- "Hard is this Day!", the Unbelievers will say.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:9: Before them the People of Noah rejected (their apostle): they rejected Our servant, and said, "Here is one possessed!", and he was driven out.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:10: Then he called on his Lord: "I am one overcome: do Thou then help (me)!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:11: So We opened the gates of heaven, with water pouring forth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:12: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, so the waters met (and rose) to the extent decreed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:13: But We bore him on an (Ark) made of broad planks and caulked with palm-fibre:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:14: She floats under our eyes (and care): a recompense to one who had been rejected (with scorn)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:15: And We have left this as a Sign (for all time): then is there any that will receive admonition?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:16: But how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:17: And We have indeed made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:18: The ’Ad (people) (too) rejected (Truth): then how terrible was My Penalty and My Warning?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:19: For We sent against them a furious wind, on a Day of violent Disaster,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:20: Plucking out men as if they were roots of palm-trees torn up (from the ground).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:21: Yea, how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:22: But We have indeed made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:24: For they said: "What! a man! a Solitary one from among ourselves! shall we follow such a one? Truly should we then be straying in mind, and mad!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:25: "Is it that the Message is sent to him, of all people amongst us? Nay, he is a liar, an insolent one!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:26: Ah! they will know on the morrow, which is the liar, the insolent one!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:27: For We will send the she-camel by way of trial for them. So watch them, (O Salih), and possess thyself in patience!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:28: And tell them that the water is to be divided between them: Each one’s right to drink being brought forward (by suitable turns).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:29: But they called to their companion, and he took a sword in hand, and hamstrung (her).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:30: Ah! how (terrible) was My Penalty and My Warning!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:31: For We sent against them a single Mighty Blast, and they became like the dry stubble used by one who pens cattle.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:32: And We have indeed made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:33: The people of Lut rejected (his) warning.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:34: We sent against them a violent Tornado with showers of stones, (which destroyed them), except Lut’s household: them We delivered by early Dawn,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:35: As a Grace from Us: thus do We reward those who give thanks.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:36: And (Lut) did warn them of Our Punishment, but they disputed about the Warning.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:37: And they even sought to snatch away his guests from him, but We blinded their eyes. (They heard:) "Now taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:38: Early on the morrow an abiding Punishment seized them:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:39: "So taste ye My Wrath and My Warning."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:40: And We have indeed made the Qur’an easy to understand and remember: then is there any that will receive admonition?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:41: To the People of Pharaoh, too, aforetime, came Warners (from God).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:42: The (people) rejected all Our Signs; but We seized them with such Penalty (as comes) from One Exalted in Power, able to carry out His Will.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:43: Are your Unbelievers, (O Quraish), better than they? Or have ye an immunity in the Sacred Books?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:44: Or do they say: "We acting together can defend ourselves"?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:45: Soon will their multitude be put to flight, and they will show their backs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:46: Nay, the Hour (of Judgment) is the time promised them (for their full recompense): And that Hour will be most grievous and most bitter
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:47: Truly those in sin are the ones straying in mind, and mad.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:48: The Day they will be dragged through the Fire on their faces, (they will hear:) "Taste ye the touch of Hell!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:49: Verily, all things have We created in proportion and measure.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:50: And Our Command is but a single (Act),- like the twinkling of an eye.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:51: And (oft) in the past, have We destroyed gangs like unto you: then is there any that will receive admonition?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:52: All that they do is noted in (their) Books (of Deeds):
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:53: Every matter, small and great, is on record.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:54: As to the Righteous, they will be in the midst of Gardens and Rivers,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 54:55: In an Assembly of Truth, in the Presence of a Sovereign Omnipotent.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:1: The Hour has drawn nigh: the moon is split.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:2: Yet if they see a sign they turn away, and they say ’A continuous sorcery!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:3: They have cried lies, and followed their caprices; but every matter is settled.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:4: And there have come to them such tidings as contain a deterrent --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:5: a Wisdom far-reaching; yet warnings do not avail.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:6: So turn thou away from them. Upon the day when the Caller shall call unto a horrible thing,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:7: abasing their eyes, they shall come forth from the tombs as if they were scattered grasshoppers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:8: running with outstretched necks to the Caller. The unbelievers shall say, ’This is a hard day!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:9: The people of Noah cried lies before them; they cried lies to Our servant, and said, ’A man possessed!’ And he was rejected.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:10: And so he called unto his Lord, saying, ’I am vanquished; do Thou succour me!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:11: Then We opened the gates of heaven unto water torrential,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:12: and made the earth to gush with fountains, and the waters met for a matter decreed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:13: And We bore him upon a well-planked vessel well-caulked
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:14: running before Our eyes-a recompense for him denied.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:15: And We left it for a sign. Is there any that will remember?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:16: How then were My chastisement and My warnings?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:17: Now We have made the Koran easy for Remembrance. Is there any that will remember?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:18: Ad cried lies. How then were My chastisement and My warnings?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:19: We loosed against them a wind clamorous in a day of ill fortune continuous,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:20: plucking up men as if they were stumps of uprooted palm-trees.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:21: How then were My chastisement and My warnings?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:22: Now We have made the Koran easy for Remembrance. Is there any that will remember?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:23: Thamood cried lies to the warnings
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:24: and said, ’What, shall we follow a mortal, one out of ourselves? Then indeed we should be in error and insanity!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:25: Has the Reminder been cast upon him alone among us? Nay, rather he is an impudent liar.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:26: ’They shall surely know tomorrow who is the impudent liar.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:27: They shall send the She-camel as a trial for them; so watch thou them and keep patience.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:28: And tell them that the water is to be divided between them, each drink for each in turn.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:29: Then they called their comrade, and he took in hand, and hamstrung her.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:30: How then were My chastisement and My warnings?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:31: We loosed against them one Cry, and they were as the wattles of a pen-builder.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:32: Now We have made the Koran easy for Remembrance. Is there any that will remember?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:33: The people of Lot cried lies to the warnings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:34: We loosed against them a squall of pebbles except the folk of Lot; We delivered them at the dawn --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:35: a blessing from Us; even so We recompense him who is thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:36: He had warned them of Our assault, but they disputed the warnings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:37: Even his guests they had solicited of him; so We obliterated their eyes, saying, ’Taste now My chastisement and My warnings!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:38: In the morning early there came upon them a settled chastisement:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:39: ’Taste now My chastisement and My warnings!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:40: Now We have made the Koran easy for Remembrance. Is there any that will remember?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:41: The warnings came also to Pharaoh’s folk.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:42: They cried lies to Our signs, all of them, so We seized them with the seizing of One mighty, omnipotent.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:43: What, are your unbelievers better than those? Or have you an immunity in the Scrolls?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:44: Or do they say, ’We are a congregation that shall be succoured?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:45: Certainly the host shall be routed, and turn their backs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:46: Nay, but the Hour is their tryst, and the Hour is very calamitous and bitter.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:47: Surely the sinners are in error and insanity!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:48: The day when they are dragged on their faces into the Fire: ’Taste now the touch of Sakar!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:49: Surely We have created everything in measure.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:50: Our commandment is but one word, as the twinkling of an eye.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:51: We have destroyed the likes of you; is there any that will remember?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:52: Every thing that they have done is in the Scrolls,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:53: and everything, great and small, is inscribed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:54: Surely the godfearing shall dwell amid gardens and a river
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 54:55: in a sure abode, in the presence of a King Omnipotent.

Muhammad Asad.verse 54:1: THE LAST HOUR draws near, and the moon is split asunder!
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:2: But if they [who reject all thought of the Last Hour] were to see a sign [of its approach], they would turn aside and say, "An ever-recurring delusion!" –
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:3: for they are bent on giving it the lie being always wont to follow their own desires.Yet everything reveals its truth in the end.
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:4: And withal, there has come unto them many a tiding that should have restrained [their arrogance]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:5: far-reaching wisdom [was held out to them]: but [since] all warnings have been of no avail,
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:6: turn thou away from them.On the Day when the Summoning Voice will summon [man] unto something that the mind cannot. conceive,
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:7: they will come forth from their graves, with their eyes downcast, [swarming about] like locusts scattered [by the wind],
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:8: running in confusion towards the Summoning Voice; [and] those who [now] deny the truth will exclaim, "Calamitous is this Day!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:9: [LONG] BEFORE those [who now deny resurrection] did Noah’s people call it a lie; and they gave the lie to Our servant and said, "Mad is he!" – and he was repulsed.
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:10: Thereupon he called out to his Sustainer, "Verily, I am defeated; come Thou, then, to my succour!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:11: And so We caused the gates of heaven to open with water pouring down in torrents,
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:12: and caused the earth to burst forth with springs, so that the waters met for a purpose pre-ordained:
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:13: but him We bore on that [vessel] made of [mere] planks and nails,
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:14: and it floated under Our eyes: a recompense for him who had been rejected with ingratitude.
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:15: And, indeed, We have caused such [floating vessels] to remain forever a sign [of Our grace unto man]: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:16: And how severe is the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded!
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:17: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’ān easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:18: TO THE TRUTH gave the lie [the tribe of] ’ād: and how severe was the suffering which I inflicted when My warnings were disregarded!
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:19: Behold, We let loose upon them a raging stormwind on a day of bitter misfortune:
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:20: it swept the people away as though they were palm-trunks uprooted:
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:21: for how severe is the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded!
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:22: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’ān easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:23: [AND the tribe of] Thamūd gave the lie to all [Our] warnings;
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:24: and they said: "Are we to follow one single mortal, one from among ourselves? In that case, behold, we would certainly sink into error and folly!
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:25: Why on him alone from among all of us should a [divine] reminder have been bestowed? Nay, but he is a boastful liar!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:26: [And God said:] "On the morrow they will come to know who the boastful liar is!
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:27: Behold, [OSālih,] We are letting loose this she-camel as a test for them; and thou but watch them, and contain thyself in patience.
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:28: And let them know that the water [of their wells] is to be divided between them, with each share of water equitably apportioned."
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:29: But they summoned their [boldest] companion, and he ventured [upon the evil deed], and cruelly slaughtered [the animal]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:30: and how severe was the suffering which I inflicted when My warnings were disregarded!
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:31: Behold, We let loose upon them one single blast [of Our punishment], and they became like the dried-up, crumbling twigs of a sheepfold.
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:32: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’ān easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:33: LOT’S PEOPLE [too] gave the lie to all [Our] warnings:
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:34: [and so,] behold, We let loose upon them a deadly tempest; and only Lot’s kinsfolk did We save at the break of dawn,
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:35: as a blessing from Us: thus do We reward all who are grateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:36: For he had truly warned them of Our punishing might; but they stubbornly cast doubt on these warnings,
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:37: and even demanded that he give up his guests [to them]: whereupon We deprived them of their sight [and thus told them, as it were]: "Taste, then, the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:38: And, indeed, abiding suffering did befall them early on the morrow:
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:39: "Taste, then, the suffering which I inflict when My warnings are disregarded!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:40: Hence, indeed, We made this Qur’ān easy to bear in mind: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:41: Now surely, unto Pharaoh’s folk [too] came such warnings;
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:42: they, too, gave the lie to all Our messages: and thereupon We took them to task as only the Almighty, who determines all things, can take to task.
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:43: ARE, THEN, those of you who [now] deny the truth better than those others – or have you, perchance, [been promised] immunity in the [ancient] books of [divine] wisdom?
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:44: Or do they say, "We are a group united, [and therefore] bound to prevail"?
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:45: [Yet] the hosts [of those who deny the truth] shall be routed, and they shall turn their backs [in flight]!
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:46: But nay – the Last Hour is the time when they shall truly meet their fate; and that Last Hour will be most calamitous, and most bitter:
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:47: for, behold, those who are lost in sin [will at that time come to know that it is they who] were sunk in error and folly!
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:48: On the Day when they shall be dragged into the fire on their faces, [they will be told:] "Taste now the touch of hell-fire!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:49: BEHOLD, everything have We created in due measure and proportion;
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:50: and Our ordaining [a thing and its coming into being] is but one [act], like the twinkling of an eye.
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:51: Thus, indeed, did We destroy people like you [in the past]: who, then, is willing to take it to heart?
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:52: [They were truly guilty] because all [the evil] that they ever did had been [revealed to them as such] in the [ancient] books of [divine] wisdom;
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:53: and everything [that man does], be it small or great, is recorded [with God].
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:54: [Hence, too,] behold, the God-conscious will find themselves in [a paradise of] gardens and running waters,
Muhammad Asad.verse 54:55: in a seat of truth, in the presence of a Sovereign who determines all things....

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:1: The Hour (of doom) has drawn near, and the moon has split asunder.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:2: When these people see a sign, they turn away and say, “(This is) a transient magic.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:3: They have rejected (the Truth) and followed their desires, while every matter has to settle (at some time).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:4: And there has come to them as much news (of the earlier communities) as it is enough to deter,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:5: (containing) a perfect wisdom. But the warnings are of no avail (to them).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:6: Therefore, turn aside (O Prophet,) from them. (They will see the reality) on the day in which the caller will call (them) to a gruesome object.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:7: With their eyes humbled, they will come out of the graves like locusts spread all over,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:8: rushing quickly towards the caller. (On that Day) the disbelievers will say, “This is a hard day.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:9: The people of NūH denied (the truth) before them. So they rejected Our servant, and said, “(He is) a madman”, and he was (also) threatened (by them).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:10: So he prayed to his Lord saying, “I am overpowered, so defend (me).”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:11: So We opened the gates of the sky with water pouring forth profusely,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:12: and We caused the earth to gush forth as springs; so the water (of both kinds) met together for a destined event.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:13: And We caused him (NūH) to board that (ship) which had planks and nails,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:14: which sailed under Our Eyes, as a reward for the one who was rejected (by the infidels).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:15: And We left it (the ship) as a sign. So, is there one to take lesson?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:16: Then how was My torment and My warnings?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:17: Indeed We have made the Qur’ān easy for seeking advice. So, is there one to heed to the advice?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:18: (The people of) ‘Ād rejected (their prophet). So how was My torment and My warnings?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:19: We did send to them a furious wind in a day of continuous misfortune,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:20: plucking people away, as if they were trunks of uprooted palm-trees.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:21: So how was My torment and My warnings?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:22: Indeed We have made the Qur’ān easy for seeking advice. So, is there one to heed to the advice?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:23: (The people of) Thamūd rejected the warners.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:24: So they said, “Shall we follow a single human being from among us? Then we will be in error and insanity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:25: Is it that the advice has been cast upon him alone out of all of us? No, but he is a bragging liar.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:26: Tomorrow they will know who the bragging liar is!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:27: We are going to send the she-camel as a trial for them; so watch them (O SāliH,) and keep patience,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:28: and tell them that water (of the well) is to be shared between them (and the she-camel), so as the right of having water shall be attended by each (alternatively).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:29: Then they called their man (to kill the she-camel,) so he undertook (the task) and killed (the she-camel).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:30: So how was My torment and My warnings?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:31: We sent upon them a single Cry, and they were like crushed leafs of a hedge-builder.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:32: Indeed We have made the Qur’ān easy for seeking advice. So, is there one to heed to the advice?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:33: The people of LūT rejected the warners.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:34: We sent upon them a rain of stones, except the family of LūT whom We saved in the last hours of night,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:35: as a grace from Us. This is how We reward the one who offers gratitude.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:36: And he (LūT) had certainly warned them of Our grasp, but they disputed the warnings.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:37: And they had even tried to tempt him against his guests (so that they may snatch them away for bad purpose,) but We blinded their eyes: “Now taste My torment and My warnings!”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:38: And on the next morning, a lasting torment overtook them:
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:39: “Now taste My torment and My warnings.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:40: Indeed We have made the Qur’ān easy for seeking advice. So, is there one to heed to the advice?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:41: And the warners came to the family of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:42: (But) they rejected all Our signs; so We seized them- a seizure by One Mighty, Powerful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:43: Are the disbelievers among you in a better position than all of the aforesaid (punished people), or do you have immunity (recorded) in the sacred books?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:44: Or do they say, “We are a large group, well-defended.”?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:45: Soon this ‘large group’ shall be defeated, and all of them will turn their backs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:46: Rather the Hour (of judgment) is their appointed time (for their full recompense), and the Hour is more calamitous and much more bitter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:47: Surely the guilty ones are in error and madness.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:48: On the Day when they will be dragged into the Fire on their faces, (it will be said to them,) “Taste the touch of Hell.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:49: Verily, We have created every thing according to (Our) predestination.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:50: And (implementation of) Our command is no more than a single act like the twinkling of an eye.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:51: We have destroyed people like you; so, is there one to take lesson?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:52: And every thing they have done is recorded in the books (of deeds).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:53: And every thing, small and big, is written down.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:54: Of course, the God-fearing will be in gardens and rivers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 54:55: in a seat of Truth, near to the Omnipotent Sovereign.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:1: The Hour has drawn near and the moon has split.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:2: And if they see a sign, they turn away and say: ‘A powerful sorcery!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:3: And they denied and followed their own desires, and every matter will be settled.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:4: And verily there has come to them such tidings as contain a deterrent,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:5: wisdom [that is] far-reaching; but warnings are of no avail.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:6: So turn away from them! On the day when the Summoner summons to an awful thing;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:7: with their downcast looks they will emerge from the graves as though they were scattered locusts,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:8: scrambling toward the Summoner. The disbelievers will say: ‘This is a hard day!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:9: The people of Noah denied before them. Thus they denied Our servant and said, ‘A madman!’, and he was reviled.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:10: And so he invoked his Lord, [saying,] ‘I have been overcome, so help !’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:11: Then We opened the gates of the heaven with torrential waters,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:12: and We made the earth burst forth with springs and the waters met for a purpose that was preordained.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:13: And We bore him on one, [made] of planks and nails,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:14: sailing before Our eyes, as retaliation for [the sake of] him who was rejected.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:15: And verily We left it as a sign. So is there anyone who will remember?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:16: How [dreadful] then were My chastisement and My warnings?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:17: And verily We have made the Qur’ān easy to remember. So is there anyone who remember?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:18: ‘ād denied. How then were My chastisement and My warnings?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:19: Indeed We unleashed upon them a clamorous wind on a day of prolonged ill fortune,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:20: tearing people away, as if they were trunks of uprooted palm-trees.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:21: How then were My chastisement and My warnings?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:22: And verily We have made the Qur’ān easy to remember. So is there anyone who will remember?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:24: and they said, ‘Is it a mortal alone among us that we are to follow? Then indeed we would be in error and insanity!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:25: Has the Reminder been cast upon him [alone] from among us? Nay, but he is a conceited liar.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:26: ‘They will know tomorrow who is the conceited liar.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:27: Lo! We are sending the She-camel as a trial for them. So watch them and remain patient.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:28: And inform them that the water is to be divided between them, every drinking will be attended’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:29: But they called their companion so he took and he hamstrung .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:30: How then were My chastisement and My warnings?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:31: Indeed We unleashed upon them a single Cry, and they became like the chaff of a corral builder.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:32: And verily We have made the Qur’ān easy to remember. So is there anyone who will remember?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 54:33: The people of Lot denied the warnings.
